page.title: 14Fawley Power Station
page.content: In 1961 consent was sought for the building of a power station on the west bank of Southampton water.This was because of the growing demand for electricity in the south. Fawley Power Station is situated on the edge of Southampton water.The station has four 500 megawatt turbines which give an electrical output of half a million kw. each and produce a voltage of 22,000 volts.The station also has four gas turbines which have an electrical output of 17,500 kw. and a voltage of 11,000 volts. Fawley Power Station is fueled by oil which comes from the nearby Esso Refinery. The power station employs 486 men and woman.The main chimney at Fawley is 650ft tall.Before the power station was built the state of the site consisted of saltings,marsh and sea.
